intro: Melanoseris leiolepis, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a waxy texture, while the flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white. This plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil.
